data.price: (1) Ṭā, Seen, Meem.[1043]
data.footnotes: [1043]- See footnote to 2:1.

data.price: (2) These are the verses of the clear Book.
(3) Perhaps, [O Muḥammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
data.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (4) If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.[1044]
data.arabic: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
data.footnotes: [1044]- i.e., they would be compelled to believe.

data.price: (5) And no mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: (6) For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
data.arabic: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ

data.price: (7) Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ

data.price: (8) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (9) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(10) And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
data.arabic: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: (11) The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allāh?"
(12) He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ

data.price: (13) And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
data.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ

data.price: (14) And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
data.arabic: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ

data.price: (15) [Allāh] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ

data.price: (16) Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers[1045] of the Lord of the worlds,
data.arabic: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [1045]- The singular form in Arabic indicates that both were sent with a single message.

data.price: (17) [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
(18) [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
data.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

data.price: (19) And [then] you did your deed which you did,[1046] and you were of the ungrateful."
data.arabic: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [1046]- i.e., striking the Copt, who died as a result.

data.price: (20) [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray [i.e., ignorant].
data.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: (21) So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me judgement [i.e., wisdom and prophethood] and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
data.arabic: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (22) And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
data.arabic: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

data.price: (23) Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
(24) [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ

data.price: (25) [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
(26) [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
(27) [Pharaoh] said,[1047] "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
data.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
data.footnotes: [1047]- Angrily addressing those present.

data.price: (28) [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: (29) [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
data.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ

data.price: (30) [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you something [i.e., proof] manifest?"
(31) [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
data.arabic: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (32) So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.[1048]
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [1048]- i.e., clearly genuine.

data.price: (33) And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
data.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ

data.price: (34) [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
data.arabic: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ

data.price: (35) He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
data.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ

data.price: (36) They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ

data.price: (37) Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
(38) So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.[1049]
data.footnotes: [1049]- i.e., the morning of the day of festival.  See 20:58-59.

data.price: (39) And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate
(40) That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
data.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: (41) And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: (42) He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
data.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

data.price: (43) Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
data.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ

data.price: (44) So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ

data.price: (45) Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ

data.price: (46) So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allāh].
(47) They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
(48) The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

(49) [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
data.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: (50) They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ

data.price: (51) Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (52) And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
data.arabic: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

data.price: (53) Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers[1050]
data.footnotes: [1050]- Recruiters of an army to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.

data.price: (54) [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
(55) And indeed, they are enraging us,
(56) And indeed, we are a cautious society..."
(57) So We removed them from gardens and springs
(58) And treasures and honorable station[1051] -
data.footnotes: [1051]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) caused them to abandon their wealth and property in pursuit of the Israelites.

data.price: (59) Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
(60) So they pursued them at sunrise.
(61) And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ

data.price: (62) [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

data.price: (63) Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (64) And We advanced thereto the others [i.e., the pursuers].
(65) And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
(66) Then We drowned the others.
(67) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (68) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(69) And recite to them the news of Abraham,
(70) When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (71) They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ

data.price: (72) He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
(73) Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
(74) They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: (75) He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
(76) You and your ancient forefathers?
(77) Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,[1052]
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [1052]- The people worshipped idols in addition to Allāh.

data.price: (78) Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
(79) And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
(80) And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
(81) And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
(82) And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (83) [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
data.arabic: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: (84) And grant me a mention [i.e., reputation] of honor among later generations.
data.arabic: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (85) And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
(86) And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
data.arabic: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: (87) And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
(88) The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ

data.price: (89) But only one who comes to Allāh with a sound heart."
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ

data.price: (90) And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
(91) And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
(92) And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (93) Other than Allāh? Can they help you or help themselves?"
data.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ

data.price: (94) So they will be overturned into it [i.e., Hellfire], they and the deviators
(95) And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
(96) They will say while they dispute therein,
(97) "By Allāh, we were indeed in manifest error
data.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: (98) When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
(99) And no one misguided us except the criminals.
(100) So now we have no intercessors
(101) And not a devoted friend.
(102) Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers..."[1053]
data.arabic: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [1053]- The conclusion of this verse is estimated as "...we would do this or that."

data.price: (103) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (104) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(105) The people of Noah denied the messengers[1054]
data.footnotes: [1054]- See footnote to 25:37.

data.price: (106) When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (107) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(108) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(109) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (110) So fear Allāh and obey me."
(111) They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
(112) He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
data.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (113) Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
data.arabic: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: (114) And I am not one to drive away the believers.
(115) I am only a clear warner."
(116) They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ

data.price: (117) He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
(118) Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
data.arabic: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (119) So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
data.arabic: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ

data.price: (120) Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
(121) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (122) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(123) ʿAad denied the messengers
(124) When their brother Hūd said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (125) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(126) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(127) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (128) Do you construct on every elevation a sign,[1055] amusing yourselves,
data.footnotes: [1055]- i.e., a symbol or indication of their wealth and power.  They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by all who passed by.

data.price: (129) And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses] that you might abide eternally?
(130) And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
(131) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(132) And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
(133) Provided you with grazing livestock and children
(134) And gardens and springs.
(135) Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
data.arabic: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: (136) They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ

data.price: (137) This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
(138) And we are not to be punished."
(139) And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (140) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(141) Thamūd denied the messengers
(142) When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (143) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(144) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(145) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (146) Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
(147) Within gardens and springs
(148) And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
(149) And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
(150) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(151) And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
(152) Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ

data.price: (153) They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
(154) You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
data.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (155) He said, "This is a she-camel.[1056] For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
data.arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
data.footnotes: [1056]- Miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allāh.

data.price: (156) And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
data.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: (157) But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
(158) And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (159) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(160) The people of Lot denied the messengers
(161) When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (162) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(163) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(164) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (165) Do you approach males among the worlds[1057]
data.footnotes: [1057]- i.e., Are there, out of all Allāh's creatures, any besides you who commit this unnatural act?

data.price: (166) And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ

data.price: (167) They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ

data.price: (168) He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
(169) My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
(170) So We saved him and his family, all,
(171) Except an old woman[1058] among those who remained behind.
data.footnotes: [1058]- Lot's wife, who had collaborated with the evildoers.

data.price: (172) Then We destroyed the others.
(173) And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
data.arabic: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: (174) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (175) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(176) The companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] denied the messengers
(177) When Shuʿayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (178) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(179) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(180) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (181) Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
data.arabic: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ

data.price: (182) And weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance.
(183) And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ

data.price: (184) And fear He who created you and the former creation."[1059]
data.footnotes: [1059]- i.e., previous generations.

data.price: (185) They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
(186) You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ

data.price: (187) So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
data.arabic: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (188) He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
(189) And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ

data.price: (190) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (191) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(192) And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
(193) The Trustworthy Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down
(194) Upon your heart, [O Muḥammad] - that you may be of the warners
(195) In a clear Arabic language.
(196) And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
(197) And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

data.price: (198) And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners[1060]
data.footnotes: [1060]- i.e., the non-Arabs or those who are not fluent in the Arabic language.

data.price: (199) And he had recited it to them [perfectly],[1061] they would [still] not have been believers in it.
data.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [1061]- As a miracle from Allāh.

data.price: (200) Thus have We inserted it [i.e., disbelief] into the hearts of the criminals.
(201) They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
data.arabic: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ

data.price: (202) And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
(203) And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
(204) So for Our punishment are they impatient?
(205) Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
(206) And then there came to them that which they were promised?
(207) They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ

data.price: (208) And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

data.price: (209) As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
(210) And the devils have not brought it [i.e., the revelation] down.[1062]
data.footnotes: [1062]- As was asserted by the disbelievers.  Rather, it was brought by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.

data.price: (211) It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
(212) Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.[1063]
data.footnotes: [1063]- As mentioned in 72:9.

data.price: (213) So do not invoke[1064] with Allāh another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
data.arabic: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ
data.footnotes: [1064]- Or "worship."

data.price: (214) And warn, [O Muḥammad], your closest kindred.
(215) And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to those who follow you of the believers.
data.arabic: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (216) And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
data.arabic: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (217) And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
(218) Who sees you when you arise[1065]
data.footnotes: [1065]- From your bed at night for prayer while you are alone.

data.price: (219) And your movement among those who prostrate.[1066]
data.footnotes: [1066]- i.e., among those who pray with you in congregation.

data.price: (220) Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
(221) Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

data.price: (222) They descend upon every sinful liar.
(223) They pass on what is heard,[1067] and most of them are liars.
data.footnotes: [1067]- This was before they were prevented, as described in 72:8-9.

data.price: (224) And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them.
(225) Do you not see that in every valley they roam[1068]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1068]- Speaking lies indiscriminately and praising and disparaging others according to whim.

data.price: (226) And that they say what they do not do? -

(227) Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allāh often and defend [the Muslims][1069] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1069]- By replying through poetry to the attacks of hostile poets.
